content.rendered:
Kiltwalk Dundee

Days
Hours
Minutes
Seconds

Support NHS Tayside Charitable Foundation with Kiltwalk Dundee

Take on an epic Kiltwalk challenge in 2025 and change lives with every step

Find out more and sign up
Create your Just Giving fundraiser

Want to walk for free? We’re offering FREE entry to the first lucky walkers who commit to raising £100! Plus, get your free charity t-shirt.

Don’t miss out! Email tay.nhstcf@nhs.scot or call 01382 633917 for your free code.

Signup Guide
  • #01
  • #02
  • #03
  • #04
  • #05
  • #06

  • #08
  • #09
  • #10
  • #11

1.⁠ ⁠Select fundraising for a charity

2.⁠ ⁠Sign in or create a Just Giving account

3.⁠ ⁠Search and select NHS Tayside Charitable Foundation

4.⁠ ⁠Select taking part in an activity

5.⁠ ⁠Select yes or no

6.⁠ ⁠Select the Kiltwalk Dundee 2025 event

7.⁠ ⁠Choose a fundraising goal – if you raise £1000 we’ll add £500

8.⁠ ⁠Personalise your page

9.⁠ ⁠Add an image (or stick with the default photo)

10.⁠ ⁠Opt in if you’d like to receive news from us

11.⁠ ⁠Scroll down and launch your page

Download your Kiltwalk Dundee welcome pack

Download Here

Patients journeys can often see them engage with multiple departments and services within NHS Tayside.  By donating to our unrestricted fund through Kiltwalk Dundee, fundraisers and supporters make it an equitable fund for distribution across all wards and departments within NHS Tayside. Some wards often receive more funding than others so the unrestricted fund allows us to support underfunded departments and services.

Find out more about our partnership with Kiltwalk
The Champions

Our Fundraising Stars

Alison Berry and Michelle Greene completed the Kiltwalk 2024 and raised £1031.25 for our general fund (not restricted to a particular ward/project) so we added £500 to their total!

Alison & Michelle Kiltwalk 2024

Alan Crighton, Kevin Stewart, Scott Robertson and Ryan Nugent completed the 3 peaks challenge on behalf of their friend John Drummond and raised £2514 for the Major Trauma Physiotherapy Unit in Ninewells Hospital!

Alan, Kevin, Scott & Ryan 3 Peaks Challenge

Jigsaw Media raised £2,500 from their moniker 10k run with half going to our general fund meaning we added £500 to the total and half going to support Dementia and Alzheimer's care at Kings Cross Hospital

Jigsaw Media Monikie 10k

serpData.description: We're the official sponsor of Kiltwalk Dundee 2025! Lace up your walking boots and join the movement! Register now for Kiltwalk Dundee 2025.
